metadata.title: CVE-2023-41887 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
OpenRefine is a powerful free, open source tool for working with messydata. Prior to version 3.7.5, a remote code execution vulnerability allowsany unauthenticated user to execute code on the server. Version 3.7.5 has apatch for this issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-41887` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openrefine - 3.5.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openrefine package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.5.2-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
